arm_group.description: Modified lateral positioning. This will ensure less pressure and stretch on shoulder than standard lateral positioning.

brief_summary.textblock:
Up to 85% experience shoulder pain after thoracic surgery, especially on the same side as
      surgery are performed. Referred phrenic nerve pain is probably one cause of ipsilateral
      shoulder pain (ISP), and positioning of the arm during surgery another. Studies indicates
      that ISP can be caused by the positioning of the patient during surgery due to muscle -and
      ligament strain. Can a change in the surgical positioning (less press and stretch) of the
      ipsilateral arm effect the shoulder pain after thoracic surgery?

clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical Positioning of the Arm During Thoracic Surgery -Effect on Shoulder Pain After Surgery?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men and women;18 years and older

          -  Thoracotomy for lung cancer

          -  Video assisted thoracic surgery for lung cancer.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Received treatment for shoulder pain

          -  Use pain medication on regular basis

          -  Under 18 year

          -  Length of stay in ICU more than 24 hours after surgery

          -  Does not understand the native language

intervention.description: Right before surgery, the patient are posistioned in lateral position with arm elevated (not more than 90 degree from torso). In the intervention, the arm will be lowered and placed in towards the torso for patients enrolled in the experimantal arm.

clinical_study.official_title: Lateral Surgical Positioning for Thoracic Surgery -Effect on Ipsilateral Shoulder Pain?

primary_outcome.description: Using visual analog scale for assesing pain in the shoulder (Scale from 0-10). Mesauring times: VAS pain related to the shoulder before surgery, VAS pain shoulder at day 1 and 3 after surgery. Further will Oslo University Hospital scheme for registration of pain for location and characteristic also be used.
primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative shoulder pain after lung surgery.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: All extra pain medication patient use after surgery until day 4, type and dose, will be mesaured.
Mesaured before surgery, and at day 1 and 3 after surgery.
Measured before surgery, and at day 1 and 3 after surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Prevention
